newsitem.title: USA: Triton Systems' IPO postponed - underwriter.
newsitem.headline: Triton Systems' IPO postponed - underwriter.

text.p: Triton Systems Inc's $27 million initial public offering has been "temporarily postponed" due to market conditions, said lead underwriter Montgomery Securities on Wednesday.
The underwriter did not indicate when the IPO might resurface.
The size of the deal had earlier been reduced to three million shares at an expected price of $9 each, from 4.2 million shares with a price range of $11 to $13 a share.
The automated teller machine maker's offering has been gathering cobwebs for a while: it was first filed in January but was repeatedly pushed back in an environment unfriendly to IPOs.
